triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper employs adaptive control techniques with parameter estimators to compensate for unknown nonlinear dynamics in the networked system.

triples.name: Fuzzy logic
triples.relevance: Fuzzy-logic systems-based approximation methods are used to approximate uncertainties in the nonlinear system dynamics.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the control problem for networked systems where control signals are transmitted through a communication network.

triples.name: Nonlinear system
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on controlling networked systems with unknown nonlinear dynamics using advanced control techniques.

triples.name: Lyapunov function
triples.relevance: Piecewise Lyapunov functionals are constructed to prove the stability and boundedness of system states and error signals.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a nonlinear observer design to estimate unmeasured system states from available output measurements.

triples.name: Feedback
triples.relevance: Output feedback control is employed to close the control loop using measured system outputs for controller design.

triples.name: Digital control
triples.relevance: A digital controller is designed to reduce frequent control updates and handle intermittent packet transmission in networked systems.

triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: Periodic event-triggered mechanisms are used to schedule intermittent packet transmission and improve communication efficiency.
